cab.content: - [This document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.] Printed for the Cabinet. November 1932.SECRET.CP. 406 (32). Copy No......9\. U-oa CABINET. AReports by Local Governments on the. Political Situation in India. I circulate for the information of my colleagues the latest weekly reports from theLocal Governments in India. S. H INDIA OFFICE, 22nd November 1932.Delhi. There is nothing of interest to report. Section 3 : arrests, nil ; total detained, 3.Section 4 : fresh orders, 1. Total to date in respect of whom orders are in force, 43 ;convictions to date for contravening orders, 10.Bombay. The situation is unchanged in the districts. In Bombaj'- city the observance ofLajpatrai "Day attracted little attention. A partial hartal was observed, and a feebleattempt to organise a procession was frustrated by the arrest of the EmergencyCoimcil and three others. Sporadic picketing is being continued and altogether15 picketers have been arrested. Some centres of Congress activity have been successfully raided. Ordinance 10. Section 3 : arrests, 7 ; total under detention,72. Section 4: orders, 18; total in force, 1,028. Section 17 : convictions, 8.Velji Lakhamsey Napoo, the President of the Grain Merchants' Association, who hasbeen secretly engaging in Congress activities, was arrested under section 3 andreleased with an order under section 4.Bengal. Civil disobedience activity is negligible. Section 3 : arrests, 6; convictions, 77.Section 4 : orders issued, 21 ; in force, 214.Madras. The situation remains unchanged. Civil disobedience activity is unimportant.There has been a decrease of interest in the campaign for the removal of un-touchability.Central Provinces. There is nothing to report. Prosecutions, 3 ; convictions, 3.United Provinces. There is nothing of importance to report, except the close of the Unity Conference.A fraction of the number of original delegates have come to agreements which willhave to be ratified at subsequent conferences. Section 3, Special Powers Ordinance,not used. Six orders under section 4 issued, and 10 convictions for defiance of orders under that section. Convictions during week under Ordinance, 56 ; under ordinary law, 43. Total, 99. Grand total up to date, 12,427.Punjab. Nine hireling Congress vohmteers were arrested at Lahore, otherwise the Provinceis entirely undisturbed by the civil disobedience movement. There is no change inthe remaining figures. 1455 60 111.32 Worth-West Frontier Province. Section 3 : arrests., nil ; total detained, 2. Section 4 : orders, 5 ; total orders inforce, 57. The situation throughout the Province is normal.Assam. There is nothing of interest to report. ...Bihar and Orissa. There is nothing to report. Five orders are still in force under section 4.Number of convictions up to 12th November, 10,934.Ajmer Merwara. There is nothing to report, and no arrests have been made.From the Resident, Mysore. The weekly report from Coorg and Bangalore is the same as last week.
